notes_display: Edge chipped; Analysis by A.A. Gordus, University of Michigan 1974, by Neutron activation of streak
issue_obverse_figure_s: Right profile of Narseh on frontal bust
issue_obverse_figure_description_s: arcaded crown surmounted by three floral elements; covered korymbos; plain diadem, diadem ribbons pointing upwards; earing consisting of two elements; neck-line of tunica edged with row of pearls; double lines running the shoulders to the breast ornament (the latter not visible); dotted border
issue_obverse_legend_s: 11 h l. o.mzdysn bg[y] nr[s]hy (miss-spellet and incomplete legend)
issue_reverse_figure_description_s: base consisting of two elements; square altar shaft; four altar slabs; altar flames depicted with vertical lines; to the left of the altar attendant with stylized crown of Narseh, holding a barsom in his left hand, right hand resting on his scabbard, to the right of the altar attendant with stylized crown of Ahuramazda, holding a barsom with both hands, both facing inwards; dotted border; to the left of the later flames symbol (SNS, var. 25), to the right symbol (SNS 3, var. 48)
issue_reverse_legend_s: 4 h l. o.  NWRA [ZY]; 8h l. o. nrshy (miss-spelt) ādur ī Nārseh|“the fire of Narseh”
